title.native: レ・ミゼラブル 少女コゼット

description:
Based on the famous classic novel Les Miserables.

Being a single mother is hard in early 19th Century France. When young Cosette was traveling with her mother trying to find a job and a place to live, they were always shunned away because very few employers hire single mothers. When she is promised with the prosperity of working in the big city, Cosette is separated from her mother in the hopes a caretaker will watch over her while her mother earns some money. Unfortunately this was a trick and the caretaker is a corrupt man who makes Cosette his indentured servant. Then the kind mayor of the town that Cosette makes her new home in sees how winds of change are so detrimental for children and families, and decides to do something about it.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Classic Literature
tags.description: Discusses or adapts a work of classic world literature.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Inn
tags.description: Partially or completely set in an Inn or Hotel.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Marriage
tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

name.native: シスター・サンプリス
ジャン・ヴァルジャン

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/75655903) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/something_Yoshimatsu/)

Affiliated with Studio Live since 1982. Studied under [Toyoo Ashida](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/). He has deep ties into [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) ever since working as a character designer on [Trigun](https://anilist.co/anime/6/) in 1998. A member of the Japanese Animation Creators Association (JAniCA).

Works as a mangaka under the name Something Yoshimatsu (サムシング吉松).

Currently freelance. Watanabe started his career as an animator at Tsuchida Production, which he left in July 1986 after the studio's bankruptcy. He then joined Studio Gallop, where he was responsible for the character designs and chief animation direction for the studio's mahou shoujo titles such as [Hime-chan no Ribbon](https://anilist.co/anime/2037/), which was his debut as a character designer, [Akazukin Chacha](https://anilist.co/anime/103/) and [Nurse Angel Ririka SOS](https://anilist.co/anime/616/) as well as the hit TV anime series [Kodomo no Omocha](https://anilist.co/anime/1486/).

Frequent collaborator with [Akitarou Daichi](https://anilist.co/staff/100640/).

**Hayato Matsuo** is a Japanese arranger, composer, orchestrator and musician. Hayato is a composer, arranger and orchestrator for both the video game industry and the anime industry. He has worked on titles such as Front Mission 3, Final Fantasy XII, the Shenmue Series, and Magic Knight Rayearth. Inspired by his mother, who was a piano teacher, he graduated from the music composition department of Tokyo University of the Arts. While in college, he composed for the band G-Clef, and occasionally stood in for the members of the band. Upon graduating, he went to work under Sugiyama Kouichi, the composer of the popular Dragon Quest video game series, arranging his pieces for Dragon Quest anime shows and soundtracks. In 1991, Hayato began to work as a video game music composer himself, writing the score to Master of Monsters. Over the next few years, he worked as an independent composer on several games and anime series, including Ogre Battle: March of the Black Queen. In 1995, he joined the independent music composition group Imagine. He has continued since then to compose and orchestrate works for over 20 games and anime shows, as well as the television show Kamen Rider 555, and a few pieces a part of original albums.

name.native: イクトー・マリー・ヒューゴー

node.description:
Victor Hugo was a French poet, playwright, novelist, essayist, visual artist, statesman, human rights activist and exponent of the Romantic movement in France.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/42231474)

The founder and representative director of [Twin Engine](https://anilist.co/studio/6199/). Originally a producer for [Fuji TV](https://anilist.co/studio/169/), where he produced numerous anime for the Noitamina programming block.
